newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Nuigini slumps after merger talks end.
newsitem.headline: Nuigini slumps after merger talks end.

text.p: Shares in gold miner Nuigini Mining Ltd fell 67 cents or almost 18 percent to A$3.15 in Friday afternoon trade after it announced that merger discussions with Battle Mountain Gold Co had ended.
Nuigini said the A$4.00 per share merger price indicated by Battle Mountain, which already holds 50.4 percent of Nuigini, was insufficient for directors to recommend any offer.
Traded volume surged after the announcement to be 380,142 by 3.45 p.m. (0545 GMT).

"There's a lot of very unhappy people out there and a quite a bit of selling to come," said one Perth broker, noting that Nuigini's share price had jumped from A$2.70 to A$3.80 on the expectation of a Battle Mountain bid.
"It could come back to A$2.70 fairly shortly," the broker said. The company said it was pursuing other corporate initiatives with a view to optimising shareholder value.
